column2: type identifier is «abstract» «tagged» «limited» [record<dl><dd>fieldname1 : type;</dd><dd>fieldname2 : type;</dd></dl>... end record |null record]
column4: Any combination of records, unions and enumerations (as well as references to those, enabling recursive types).
column5: type identifier (variation : discrete_type) is record<dl><dd>case variation is<dl><dd>when choice_list1 =><dl><dd>fieldname1 : type;</dd><dd>...</dd></dl></dd></dl><dl><dd>when choice_list2 =><dl><dd>fieldname2 : type;</dd><dd>...</dd></dl></dd></dl><dl><dd>...</dd></dl>end case;</dd></dl>end record

column3: Required types and operators can be user defined

column4: enum name { case Foo«(types)» case Bar «(types)» ... }

column2: Structure name <dl><dd> Dim name As type ... </dd></dl> End Structure
TYPE name <dl><dd> type :: name ... </dd></dl> END TYPE

column4: abstract class name case class Foo(«parameters») extends name case class Bar(«parameters») extends name ... or abstract class name case object Foo extends name case object Bar extends name ... or combination of case classes and case objects
type name = Foo «of type» | Bar «of type» | ...

column2: level-number name type clauses. level-number+n name type clauses. ...
